acqinfo.p: The first accession was donated by the School of Nursing Alumni Association (Donor No. 7032) in 1984. Periodic additions have been received.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copy is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, School of Nursing Alumni Association (University of Michigan) Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The School of Nursing Alumnae Association was formed in 1900 and changed its name to the Nurses Alumni Association in 1969. The name was changed again in 1993, to the Nursing Alumni Society, and administrative control was placed within the School of Nursing. Still an active organization, its purpose is to advance the interests of the University of Michigan School of Nursing and to promote good fellowship among graduates.

Planning reunions is only one activity of the Association. Its members also offer the Shirley C. Titus Scholarship to a nursing student each year. The Scholarship was started by the graduating class of 1930 with $250. By 1980, the endowment had grown to over $30,000. The Association has also been an active part of the University of Michigan Alumni Association and several members have served on the Class Officers Council. The Association also publishes a newsletter several times a year which informs members of the activities of other alumni.

scopecontent.p: The records of the School of Nursing Alumni Association of the University of Michigan date from 1907 to 1993, and measure four linear feet. In addition to documenting the growth of the organization and the interests and activities of the alumni, the collection also includes information about the development of nursing as a profession. The records include organizational records, correspondence, topical files, printed material, collected material regarding the careers of individual alumni of the University of Michigan School of Nursing, and photographs.

scopecontent.p: Organizational Records, 1909-1998, contain the constitution, by-laws and minutes of the Association. Also included are financial records dating from 1924 to 1998.

Correspondence, 1907-1980, is arranged chronologically and includes official correspondence of the Association and letters from members. Included in the early correspondence are letters from alumnae who worked abroad and wrote about their experiences.

The Topical Files are arranged alphabetically and document the activities of the Association. Of interest are two surveys done in the 1920s by Shirley Titus who was Director of Nursing Service and the School of Nursing for six years.

Alumni Personal Papers includes the papers of three graduates. Minnie Holzhauser worked as a nurse in Bursah, India in the early 1900s and Olive McDonald was a nurse during World War II with the University of Michigan affiliated 298th General Hospital. Thelma Stegeman's manuscript, Sunshine and Shadow, is a fictional account of her experiences in the School of Nursing. Stegeman, who graduated in 1924, was head nurse at the University of Michigan Health Service Clinic for more than 30 years.

Printed Material includes five journals published by the Alumni Association between 1907 and 1914, directories of members and the News Bulletin. The Bulletin is mailed to members of the Association and contains notices of reunions and, principally, news of alumni by class.
Photographs include class pictures, photos of reunions, nursing members, and nursing-related university buildings.
